brewery.brewery_description:
Daydreaming from desk jobs, we were constantly living with our head in the clouds.
Emails, meetings, empty staplers, jammed and inkless printers, End of Month, synergies. It’s not hard to want something more.
We don’t think we’re alone in this – we know you can relate to wanting to escape the daily grind. But for us it was more a dream of embracing the daily mash.

Brewing was always our weekly escape, a creative outlet, a passionate hobby, and even a side-hustle as we tried to live two lives.
But now we’re diving in head-first to make this more than a dream.
Come share the fruits of our labour and love, with a local or three, at Plant 3, Bowden.

beer.beer_description:
Seize the day, and secure the deal of your life with Carpet Demon. A devilishly hoppy IPA, woven with tempting aromas, and a bitterness you won't soon forget. For a sliver of your soul, get unparalleled refreshment. A deal so good, you'll be signing on the dotted line... with your taste buds.

Malts - Pale, Aurora, Biscuit

Hops - Nectaron, Superdelic, Motueka

Yeast - Safale US-05

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 155 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 32!

Look, even planet-busters need to talk it out sometimes. Or maybe just drink this ridiculously tasty Pale Ale? Its El Dorado & Galaxy hop flavour clocks in OVER 9000! Go Super Sane. Your therapist (and taste buds) will thank you.

Malts - Pale, Biscuit, Light Crystal, Aurora

Hops - El Dorado, Galaxy, Simcoe Cryo

Yeast - Safale US-05

items.badge_description: Do you come from the land down under, where beer does flow, and men chunder? That's at least 65 different beers from Australia. Try 5 more for Level 14.

beer.beer_description:
This Choc Apricot Stout is for the moments right before everything goes to shit. It’s a blissfully ignorant, world-endingly delicious beer. Because if you’re going to get wiped out by a meteor, you might as well have a tasty drink in your hand.

Malts - Ale, Light Chocolate, Toffee, Munich, Flaked Barley

Hops - Fuggle

Yeast - Safale US-05

Other - Cacao Nibs, Apricot Puree

Some horses play polo. Others decode deliciousness. This hazy session IPA is a five-star general of flavour, leading a charge of juicy citrus and tropical fruit from an elite squadron of hops. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to drink up. Giddy up.

Malts - Pale, Flaked Wheat, Flaked Oats

Hops - Cascade, Azacca, Citra, Simcoe, Superdelic

Yeast - Pomona

Change is as constant as the seasons, and rather than fight it we thought we'd embrace it fruitfully. The Apricots are tasting sweet, and this little number's a Fruity treat......(Sorry, we will try and improve our puns)

Fresh, tart, moreish, and thick with that luscious apricot juiciness. This beer is ripe for the drinking, taste it now!

Alright Earthlings, prepare for a close encounter of the dankest kind! This Dank WCIIPA is so out-of-this-world, intergalactic visitors have officially started trading their probes for pints! Resistance is futile so get ready to be Taken Away

Malts - Ale, Munich, Light Crystal

Hops - Centennial, Cashmere, Columbus, Simcoe, Simcoe Cryo

Yeast - Safale US-05

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 135 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 28!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 200 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 41!

user.bio: Get out there and get into it!

items.badge_description: Not your dad's lifeless, fizzy suds of yore, American, American Light, and American Amber lagers today are complex craft beers perfect for the beach, pool, or backyard? AVAILABLE ONLY TO UNTAPPD INSIDERS

items.checkin_comment: 4 Sir Eric Neal a good supporter of the Club RIP; Malts - Ale, Light Chocolate, Toffee, Munich, Flaked Barley; Hops - Fuggle; Yeast - Safale US-05; Other - Cacao Nibs, Apricot Puree: and the RWNJ s and Trumpians who are BI those fuckwits should enjoy Bi

user.location: Adelaide, South Australia via old London Town

beer.beer_description:
In a past life, staring at spreadsheets for hours on end left brewers Al and Jake’s minds a little hazy. These days, countless hours spent in the brewery produce a far more refreshing haze. Bowden’s HAZY Pale Ale is super sessionable, soft and packed with a medley of tropical, stone and citrus fruit notes thanks to a generous helping of Citra, Galaxy and Mosaic hops. It’s the perfect cure for that weekday brain fog.
Malts: Coopers Pale, Gladfield Big-O, Gladfield Wheat

Hops: Citra, Galaxy, Mosaic

Yeast: Verdant IPA

The original sinspiration, we fell in love with WCIPA’s on our first US roadtrip. Now we’ve thrown caution to the trade winds, tossed asunder our jobs, and dived headfirst into the unknown. We’ve brewed this impression of a true West (is best) Coast IPA, full of all those lingering memories and flavours. Just as the forest hugs the coastline, this pairs a big green bitter hit and resiny pine, with fresh citrus, tropical fruits, and even hints of floral blossoms for those that get that far south. Refreshing like a dip in the Pacific, but with the boldness you’d expect from a yank. Take the plunge.

Malts: Extra Pale, Aurora, Acidulated

Hops: Magnum, Citra, Idaho#7, Mosaic, Simcoe

Yeast: Safale US-05

Some things just can’t be described, ya know? They just mean something different to everyone.

We spent hours after we made this tasty drop, sinking these and throwing around names, but nothing seemed to stick… Yes it’s purple and lemony, but it’s more than lemons. And what does purple even taste like?

Kind of makes you just want to yeet it down, yeet the can, and then get on yeeting. Whatever that means. Yes, YEET will do nicely.

Ingredients: Lemon Juice, Yeet

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
beer.beer_description:
So what is this beer exactly? Well obviously it’s a space snake. You don’t need to be a genius scientist or an FBI agent to solve this riddle; use your (danger) noodle and get hoppythetical with us.
This hazy is a hop-lover’s delight showcasing a velvety smooth and elegant oat cream body – just as svelte as we asp-ired. But don’t let that fool you, it can definitely pack a bite with the sting in its tail.
Too many of these hurt-juices, and you’ll also be legless. Hopped at 3 separate stages of the brewing process, you will get huge notes of tropical and pine forests – where all the best nope-ropes and murder spagurder’s come from. Not space. Duh. But this is definitely the antivenin to feeling spacey or flat-tyred after a long week. Sink your fangs into it. (We know – we’re hiss-terical).

Malts: Pale, Wheat, Big O, Flaked Oats, Acidulated

Hops: Eclipse, Mosaic, Citra

Yeast: London Ale III

We’ve spent so long daydreaming about this, so that you can enjoy it for the long haul. And while we can’t condone all-day drinking (#responsible), should you ever find yourself stuck in the haze of an endless spiral of rounds, this should be your go-to. A crisp and crushable fresh sesh boasting tropical fruits, citrus, and a clean airy finish that won’t leave you with that heavy feeling (of regret). And hopefully both your eyebrows intact. No promises.

Malts: Pale Malt, Munich I, Malted Wheat, Unmalted Wheat, Acidulated

Hops: Magnum, Galaxy, Citra

Yeast: Safale US-05

You better believe it pays to stay local. We’re reclaiming what’s ours, so here ‘tis: Bowden’s Own Draught. A beer born and brewed around the corner, by and for our neighbours and locals. Heaps approachable, this new SA icon packs a dry yet balanced finish with low bitterness and a mild hint of toasty roasty nutty-ness. Not a local? Well you’ll have to ‘come to South Australia’ to fully appreciate this, as it ain’t moving to Victoria any time soon.

Malts: American Ale, Malted Wheat, Carapils

Hops: Magnum, Cascade

Yeast: Safale US-05

What would happen if you rocked up to your Nan’s tea party with a 4 pack of freshly brewed IPA..? Probably something like this… Soolong Sucka is an American IPA that combines new world hops with old world tea to create something both Nan and Dad will enjoy. Soothing aromas of Oolong and black tea complimented by subtle hints of raspberry and monk pear pair with new world hops to create a balanced but unique take on an American IPA. With a harmonious blend of tea and hops on the palate, this beer delivers a refreshing and nuanced drinking experience for tea and beer lover alike.

Malts – Ale, Gladiator & Biscuit

Hops – Idaho 7, Pacific Jade, Pacifica

Yeast – Safale US-05

Other – Oolong Tea, Earl Grey Tea, Munk Pear Tea & Raspberries

Easter is always heartily busy, especially when you make the best hot cross buns in town! So, without egging you all on, we’ve stepped-in help our friends at Lost Loaf out by rolling out a liquid alternative! We haven’t gone hopping mad with this one – this here is an English-style brown ale, that lets the malt base shine with a subtle spice and dried fruit aroma layered on top. We’d love to say it’s choc-full, but we think that’s sacrilege. Instead, this has plenty of those fruity characters, and a healthy boozy kick to boot. Guaranteed to get you through the long weekend, including having to dress up as some evil bunny to hide eggs for the cousins you see only twice a year. We got you, fam.

Malts: Ale, Munich, Red Back, Black Forrest Rye, Light Crystal, Eclipse Wheat

Hops: East Kent Goldings

Yeast: SafAle English Ale

Ingredients: Cinnamon, Mixed Spice, Fig, Raisin, Sultana, Apricot
Nitro red ale

Change is as constant as the seasons, and rather than fight it we thought we’d embrace it fruitfully. This is our distinctive kettle-soured base – kept fresh with generous seasonal fruit drops, only using what’s falling off the trees and begging to be brewed.

This just happens to be (Cheeky Mango). Creamy, tart, moreish, and thick of that heady ripe juiciness. Nothing about this is the pits. Like the real deal, sit down, spread your legs, embrace it, and let the juices run down your hands. Just don’t get too messy devouring this

Malts: Pale, Wheat, Gladiator, Acidulated

Hops: Eclipse

Yeast: Safale US-05, SafSour LP-652

Ingredients: Mango Puree

Trouble drifting off? In need of a decent night’s siesta? Well stop counting, sheeple. What you need is a trusty nightcap, and we have just the thing: a big, smooth, decadent porter packed full of delicious sleep-promoting goodies (hops, lavender flower, chamomile flower, and passion flowers) to help give you the full forty winks. Sweet dreams are made of this. Think dark chocolate overlayed with smooth lavender and a decent boozy finish. Highly recommend you finish your evening with one of these or grab it to take away. May induce (drunken) drowsiness. You’ve been warned.

Malts: Pale, Light Crystal, Dark Chocolate, Munich, Biscuit, Eclipse Wheat

Hops: East Kent Goldings

Yeast: Safale S-04

Other: Cacao Nibs, Lavender Flowers, Chamomile Flowers, Passion Flowers

Warning: Tactical porpoises detected in your glass! These spec-ops sea mammals have gone AWOL with your taste buds, dropping depth charges of juicy hops and executing classified manoeuvres in pure haze warfare. Thick, creamy, and absolutely flippin' delicious. Don't forget your security clearance... and a snorkel.

Malts: Pale, Flaked Wheat, Flaked Oats

Hops: Motueka, Nectaron, Superdelic

Yeast: English Ale II

Its our 1st BIRTHDAY and look at how big we’ve gotten!!!

What’s better to do than have a 1st birthday party with all our Work Mates! We’ve brought out the icecream cake and fairy bread and turned it into a thick syrupy imperial stout. layered with chocolate, vanilla, coconut and lashings of everything which makes a first birthday great!

Malts: Pale, Biscuit, Dark Crystal, Munich, Shepherds Delight, Light Chocolate, Flaked Oats, Toffee, Brown, Supernova, Red Back, Roast Barley

Hops: Fuggle

Yeast: Safale US-05, Nottingham

Step into a world of hop-fueled adventure with Battle Ducks Red IPA! Witness the epic clash of flavours as a mech-suited warrior duck faces off against a fallen rubber ducky. Will good overcome evil in this ultimate battle of tastes? Our friend rubber ducky may seem beaten, but rest assured, he’s got a few quackin’ good moves left! Strap yourself in for a taste sensation, as you savour the rich malty body and stonefruitesque hoppiness of Battle Ducks Red IPA. Get your swords of thirst ready and let the quackery begin! ???️

Malts: Pale, Shepherds Delight, Aurora, Red Back, Gladiator

Hops: Centennial, Citra, Eclipse, Kohatu, Motueka

Yeast: Safale US05

We love our accountant Adam, he’s the opposite of a Scrooge. But he was pretty upset when he found out just how much coffee went in our last few batches. That might just be his caffeine levels dipping; we’ll get Dawn Patrol onto it. Still, he was adamant (lol) that we count the beans this time. So we thought, what better job for an accountant than counting beans, sorry Adam.

This porter is not as heavy or thick as a coffee stout, so it really lets the natural fruity acid balance of the coffee shine through. To be enjoyed with your favourite accountant.

Malts: Coopers Ale, Malted Oats, Carafa 2, Dark Crystal, Munich, Light Chocolate, Dark Chocolate

Hops: Magnum

Yeast: Safale S-04

Ingredients: Dawn Patrol Coffee

Stripes, curves, diamond, checkerboard… lawn mowing isn’t merely a chore, it’s an artistic expression, even a way of life. We’ve done our best to help you avoid some of the minefields out there (apart from the ones your dog kindly donates); ’Snean Weather’ is a sessionable hazy pale, designed to be the perfect mowing companion this Spring. The combination of juicy body, dry finish and tropical fruit presence make this the perfect beer to sip while on the go, watching it grow or just taking it slow. Using a unique blend of American & Australian hops, there are nice hints of citrus & passionfruit throughout first sip to last. So lace up those New Balances and as always; mow dry, mow high & mow sharp.

Malts: Pale, Wheat, Flaked Oats, Flaked Wheat

Hops: Citra, Vic Secret, Idaho 7

Yeast: Bluestone BSY-A011 New England

A hoppy revolution in your glass! This West Coast Double IPA storms the Bastille of bland with guillotine-sharp bitterness and explosive citrus notes. Ribbiting with flavour, it’s the beer that’ll make you croak “Liberté, Égalité, Fraternité!” Raise your flagons, brave amphibians!

Malts: Pale, Aurora, Rye, Caramunich I

Hops: Mosaic, Simcoe, Topaz, Simcoe Cryo, Mosaic Cryo

Yeast: Safale US-05

We love a good time. Do you know who else loves a good time? John Travolta. Man, that guy can boogie! We're not great dancers but we can make some damn tasty beers. So we’re throwing a party for your mouth, and you’re invited… introducing our Silent Disco Double Dry Hop Pale.

Flavours can’t be heard, but if they could, this would be a certified banger. The Azacca, Chinook & Ella hop combination add stone fruit and tropical elements to the subtle biscuit and toffee malt finish. The result is a fruity and lush beer, with a full body and crisp finish. This is one party you don’t want to miss out on. BYO flares.

El Dorado, Galaxy, Azacca

Yeast: Bluestone BSY-A011 New England

When the working day is done, Santa just wants to have fun. We have no doubt the fat man loves to party with a cold beer in hand – so we’ve brewed a Double IPA in his honour. Utilising a combination of hops that spell out ‘CHRISTMAS’, this bold IIPA delivers a rich, piney and fruit-forward mouthful rounded out with a touch of bitterness at the back. This beer truly is the seasonal gift that keeps on giving.

Malts: Ale, Munich, Biscuit

Hops: Citra, Herkules, Raku, Idaho 7, Simcoe, Talus, Mosaic, Amarillo, Simcoe Cryo,

Yeast: Verdant IPA

Other: Candy Canes, Christmas Cheer!

Beer aficionados of the cosmos, prepare for an out-of-this-world experience with our latest creation: Cosmic Touch. Indulge in a celestial journey with this hazy IPA… gently embrace juicy fruits and a velvety mouthfeel that leaves you longing for more. Let Citra, Mosaic, and Galaxy hops delicately dance across your palate, creating a tapestry of tropical mango, pineapple, and grapefruit zest. There’s nothing like a tender embrace from a lover cosmic AI overlord.

Malts: Pale, Flaked Oats, Flaked Wheat, Chit

Hops: Cascade, Citra, Mosaic, Galaxy, Citra Cryo, Mosaic Cryo

Yeast: London Ale III

Portal is a rich and hearty stout with notes of biscoff to warm the belly and soul on those cold winter nights. Created in collaboration with Illuminate Adelaide — South Australia’s brightest celebration of art, light, music, food and technology — awaken your senses and emerge from your hibernation this July to explore Adelaide in a new light. Here’s cheers to the unforgettable winter moments!

Malts - Ale, Wheat, Munich, Biscuit, Raw Wheat, Eclipse Wheat, Dark Crystal

Hops - East Kent Goldings

Yeast - Ferveo English Ale II

Other - Biscoff

Feast your eyes on this Son of a Bun—a rebellious chocolate hot cross brown ale from the twisted ovens of Bowden Brewing & The Lost Loaf. Spice-laced, cocoa-kissed, hopped right outta the dough bin, and ready to crash your Easter. Sip if you dare—taste the chocolate carnage!

Malts: Ale, Munich, Light Chocolate

Hops: East Kent Goldings

Yeast: Safale US-05

Other: Cacao Nibs, Mixed Spices
